post.title: Why I dont feel as bad being single

body:
Lol I'm done trying to justify myself. I DO feel entitled to a relationship. I'm a nice decent person and I take care of myself.

Imagine living in the boomer generation where looks-match existed and almost everyone had a spouse. Seeing that as example growing up, being preached the "American Dream" my whole life, only to suddenly be told "YoU'rE NoT EnTiTlEd tO AnYtHiNg!!" 

Okay, so live my life and try my hardest and I maybe get a good life or I maybe get jack shit? Fuck that.

post.title: Why I dont feel as bad being single

body:
There are multiple facets to misogyny, is what I was essentially saying. The term has been corrupted from meaning just 'woman hating' to now mean something entirely different. You an alpha male who lays a woman and then dumps her? Misogynist. Do you want a classic nuclear family where you provide and your wife takes care of the household? Misogynist.

Stop misrepresenting my argument by coopting leftist rhetoric when it's convenient.

Now, on to your 'proof'. 

Your first 'source' is a study done on a tiny dataset, (Less than three thousand! Total of both sexes.), and the numbers are far from conclusive even if you disregard that. Not to mention, the study was taken in Spain, a country where machismo is seen as the norm, schewing the numbers even further.

Your second source shows young misogynistic men are more likely to get stds and get women pregnant. (No other numbers are conclusive in any way, showing expactable deviation). Does this mean they get more sex? No, you fuck wit, it more likely means they less often use condoms.

On top of all this, judging by what 'sources' you present, you apparently think love and sex are synonyms, but that couldn't be farther from the truth. A fuck boy party animal who brings home a different girl every week has loved less than a man who stays with the same girl for several years. 

Your sources are cherry picked trash you probably didn't even read. Your world view is skewed, or you're arguing in bad faith. Ad hominem attack is the cherry on the cake. Fuck off, clown.
body_html:
There are multiple facets to misogyny, is what I was essentially saying. The term has been corrupted from meaning just 'woman hating' to now mean something entirely different. You an alpha male who lays a woman and then dumps her? Misogynist. Do you want a classic nuclear family where you provide and your wife takes care of the household? Misogynist.

Stop misrepresenting my argument by coopting leftist rhetoric when it's convenient.

Now, on to your 'proof'.

Your first 'source' is a study done on a tiny dataset, (Less than three thousand! Total of both sexes.), and the numbers are far from conclusive even if you disregard that. Not to mention, the study was taken in Spain, a country where machismo is seen as the norm, schewing the numbers even further.

Your second source shows young misogynistic men are more likely to get stds and get women pregnant. (No other numbers are conclusive in any way, showing expactable deviation). Does this mean they get more sex? No, you fuck wit, it more likely means they less often use condoms.

On top of all this, judging by what 'sources' you present, you apparently think love and sex are synonyms, but that couldn't be farther from the truth. A fuck boy party animal who brings home a different girl every week has loved less than a man who stays with the same girl for several years.

Your sources are cherry picked trash you probably didn't even read. Your world view is skewed, or you're arguing in bad faith. Ad hominem attack is the cherry on the cake. Fuck off, clown.

post.title: Why I dont feel as bad being single

body:
You don't need a pill to be unlovable :^] 
Jokes aside, I support you doing whatever you need to lead your best life. I also know playing the blame game isn't productive.

It's been said, but even the ugliest fucker can make himself presentable and likable, if he puts in the effort. Yeah, others don't need to put in any effort. Life is not fair. Suck it up and go do something productive.
